  physical_appearance: This is a list of unrecorded medicines issued by Dutch East India Company (VOC) and Dutch West India Company (WIC) for their overseas garrisons. This list contains lines of text in Latin
 referring to medicines and their ingredients. The pages are slightly browned and soiled near the edges. Otherwise the list remains wholly untrimmed and generally in good condition.

  subject_terms_1: medicines (material)

  subject_terms_2: Lists

  subject_terms_3: Medical care

  sgcool_label_text: This is a list of simple and compound medicine issued by the Dutch government for use by the Dutch East India Company (VOC) and Dutch West India Company (WIC)
 who had troops stationed abroad. They could be used in the hospitals of Dutch garrisons with fewer than 3000 men. The medicines could be prepared on site following the The Hague pharmacopoeia of 1738 – which was a Latin text that was the official source for the municipality of the Hague in the Netherlands.

metadata.title_text:
List of unrecorded medicines issued by Dutch East India Company (VOC) and Dutch West India Company (WIC).for their overseas garrisons.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a list of unrecorded medicines issued by Dutch East India Company (VOC) and Dutch West India Company (WIC) for their overseas garrisons. This list contains lines of text in Latin, referring to medicines and their ingredients. The pages are slightly browned and soiled near the edges. Otherwise the list remains wholly untrimmed and generally in good condition.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a list of simple and compound medicine issued by the Dutch government for use by the Dutch East India Company (VOC) and Dutch West India Company (WIC), who had troops stationed abroad. They could be used in the hospitals of Dutch garrisons with fewer than 3000 men. The medicines could be prepared on site following the The Hague pharmacopoeia of 1738 – which was a Latin text that was the official source for the municipality of the Hague in the Netherlands.
